text:
I am saddened by the events that transpired yesterday.  The Motion to Vacate was not in the interest of the country or the institution.

Speaker McCarthy’s display of leadership throughout his tenure is a true reflection of his respect for the U.S. House of Representatives, and I’m thankful for his dedicated service to our country.  Working together and under his leadership, our razor-thin majority achieved significant conservative policy wins while putting a halt to the extreme left-wing agenda of President Biden and his Democrat colleagues in the House and Senate.

Only in a perverse world of the irrational would @SpeakerMcCarthy be removed for the leadership he has provided in guiding a razor-thin majority to major conservative wins, including $2 trillion in spending cuts, passage of the strongest border security bill in a generation, the streamlining of energy infrastructure projects, and shining a light on corruption within our government.

Speaker McCarthy deserves our support as we move forward and continue to bring accountability to Washington.

During this time, the House will continue to work to pass appropriations bills for FY24 to reduce spending and the scope of government and then negotiate with the Senate and White House to get these measures passed by the Senate and signed into law.
The CR passed by both the House and the Senate today keeps the federal government operating for 45 days at the spending levels of FY23.

It instituted a debt commission to address the out-of-control Entitlement Spending which accounts for 75% of total spending driving the debt, and it would have significantly enhanced our ability to force the President’s hand to secure the border. Unfortunately, that vote failed.

It cut spending by 27 percent for every category of Discretionary Spending except for Defense, Homeland Security, and Veterans Affairs for the duration of the time needed until new appropriation measures are signed into law for FY24.
A few days ago, I voted for a Continuing Resolution (CR) that would have put us in a strong position to negotiate with the Democrat Majority in the Senate.
Additionally, shutdowns are very damaging to our military readiness as well as our men and women in uniform, border security and border security personnel, and veterans among many others.
As counter intuitive as it may seem, shutdowns of any length cost taxpayers billions more than keeping the government open.

With my support, @HouseGOP passed legislation to combat record setting illegal border crossings.

Will the Biden Administration join us or continue ignoring this deadly crisis?

Proud to lead today’s @TransportGOP Water Resources & Environment Subcommittee hearing on ways we can improve our clean water infrastructure, protect against environmental degradation, and keep costs low for ratepayers.

New records reveal the Biden family received payments from Chinese nationals listing Joe Biden’s home as the beneficiary address while he was running for President in 2019.

@HouseGOP’s impeachment inquiry will ensure all Americans are equipped with the truth.

A tropical storm warning is now in effect for portions of Southeastern North Carolina, including Pender and New Hanover Counties.
 
Please continue to monitor the situation, heed the advice of local officials, and stay safe.

.@SecretaryPete Buttigieg refuses to stop @USDOT’s use of Chinese manufactured drones to inspect our national infrastructure.

Other agencies have banned the practice, @USDOT ought to do the same.

Due to powerful swells from Hurricane Lee, dangerous swimming conditions are expected along our local beaches through Saturday. Even distant hurricanes can have a deadly impact, so make sure to stay safe using the resources below!

✅Swim near a lifeguard
✅Check the beach forecast before you go
✅Never assume the ocean is safe, even if the storm isn’t visible

Today we remember the innocent Americans who lost their lives — on that day and since that day — as a result of the terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001.  Our lives were forever changed by these attacks, but through extraordinary service and sacrifice, the greatness of the American people prevailed.
 
Together, we honor and remember the heroes who sacrificed then and now.  We will Never Forget.

I stopped in Bladen County to meet with NC-07 farmers who serve on my Agriculture Advisory Council. I appreciate their input on issues impacting North Carolina farm families as Congress works to craft a strong 2023 Farm Bill.

I enjoyed stopping for lunch at the Elizabethtown Farmer's Market!

It was great to see Bladen County Sheriff McVicker, Mac Campbell, Elizabethtown Mayor Sylvia Campbell, Bladen County Clerk of Court Cristin Hursey, and others who do so much for the Bladen County community.

Southeastern North Carolina should expect heavy rainfall and possible flash flooding due to Hurricane Idalia. Please review the following flood safety tips to help you stay safe during the storm.

Remember, do NOT drive through running water! Almost all who have died from flooding are those who chose to drive through running water.

While Hurricane Idalia made landfall in Florida as a Category 3 storm, our region should expect heavy rain and possible flash flooding or tornadoes beginning late tonight into Thursday.

Tropical Storm Warnings are now in effect for Brunswick, Columbus, New Hanover, Pender, Bladen, Robeson, and Cumberland Counties.

Please continue to monitor the situation and stay safe.

It’s important to be aware of the potential impacts Hurricane Idalia could have on our region like heavy rainfall, high winds, and a few tornadoes.  

Please monitor the forecast & take necessary safety precautions.

Two years ago today, 13 American servicemembers lost their lives in the withdrawal from Afghanistan.  Join me in honoring their service & praying for the family members they left behind.

House Republicans will continue investigating this evacuation to deliver justice for these heroes who made the ultimate sacrifice.

Working for our veterans in Southeastern North Carolina is one of my top priorities.

During the latest meeting of my Veterans Advisory Council, it was an honor to receive their advice, listen to their thoughts and concerns, and collaborate on how we can ensure every veteran has access to the support they deserve.

Since 1898, @pepsi has found a home in North Carolina.

Thanks to Pepsi Bottling Ventures for showing me around the state-of-the-art distribution facility in Maxton. I enjoyed meeting the employees & learning more about the economic impact the beverage industry has on our state.

I was pleased to join @RepWexton in introducing the bipartisan Agritourism Act to help farmers and entire rural communities benefit from the economic opportunities agritourism has to offer. 

Read more ➡️rouzer.house.gov/news/docume…

Today marks two years since President Joe Biden’s disastrous withdrawal of U.S. troops from Afghanistan.  To date, the President, nor anyone in his Administration, has taken responsibility for the deadly catastrophe or the lives of our allies and the women and children who have been killed or enslaved there since.  

House Republicans will continue investigating this evacuation to deliver justice for the thirteen U.S. servicemembers who lost their lives, our allies who supported us, our veterans who kept our homeland safe while serving in Afghanistan, and the American people.

Those who served in Afghanistan must know their service was not in vain.  Over the course of those twenty years, these heroes made great sacrifice to achieve the mission of keeping every American and our homeland safe.  They did their job, and they did it well.

I’m excited to invite students in NC-07 to participate in the 2023 Congressional App Challenge!

Students interested in learning to code and creating their own applications are encouraged to apply. All entries are due on November 1st.

More info here: rouzer.house.gov/services/co…

This National Purple Heart Day we honor the brave heroes of our Armed Forces who were killed or wounded in defense of our country.   Because of their service and sacrifice, the United States remains free.  May God always bless our Nation’s heroes and their families.

It’s been great having Alden, Jacob, James, and Katie as my Washington, DC office interns this summer.  

Thank you for all of your hard work on behalf of North Carolina’s 7th District! #NationalInternDay

Proud to join @RepDustyJohnson & @RepColinAllred in hosting today’s Supply Chain Caucus roundtable on permitting challenges & supply chain disruptions.

Mitigating these roadblocks will help keep important infrastructure projects and goods moving.

It was an honor to meet with @NCNationalGuard Adjutant General, Major General Todd Hunt.  We discussed the recent passing of the NDAA, which contains a 5.2% pay raise for servicemembers.

Thank you to all who serve in the NC National Guard for your service to our state & nation!

Since the Wright Brothers flew the first successful flight in NC, the US has maintained leadership in global aviation.

I'm proud to support the 2023 FAA reauthorization to strengthen American aviation & improve reliability for the increasing amount of passengers taking to the skies.

Today, Israeli President @Isaac_Herzog addressed a Joint Meeting of Congress.  His insightful remarks reaffirmed the importance of a strong U.S.-Israel partnership and detailed how our two democracies can continue to strengthen our bond.

I was proud to cast my vote in support of @RepPfluger’s resolution rejecting antisemitism and expressing support for a strong U.S.-Israel partnership.

House Republicans will always stand with Israel.

It was a pleasure to spend time in Fairmont and meet with Mayor Charles Kemp, Town Manager Jerome Chestnut and other town officials.

Our small towns are a vital component to the quality of life that North Carolina offers, and I am proud to represent so many in NC-07.

Congress has a fundamental duty to improve and enhance our nation's military readiness to deter ever-evolving threats from around the globe. This year's NDAA improves our readiness at home and abroad while also ensuring taxpayer dollars are spent responsibly.

The Lumbee Warriors Association honors Lumbee Service Members & veterans as well as local, state & federal elected officials for their service.

I’m extremely proud of their efforts to assist the veteran community, and grateful to receive a Lumbee Warriors pin & Warrior’s patch.

I’m proud to join my colleagues in introducing the American Confidence in Elections (ACE) Act. 

This bill will bolster confidence in our elections and protect the vote of every single American! #ACEAct

I’m excited to announce my office is accepting applications for the Fall 2023 internship program! Interns will have the opportunity to gain hands on experience with the legislative process and attend briefings, hearings, and meetings on Capitol Hill.

The deadline to apply is Friday, July 28!

Visit my website below for more information.
rouzer.house.gov/forms/inter…

With hurricane season in full swing, homeowners, renters and business owners should examine your flood insurance plans.

For more information on how you can prepare before disaster strikes, visit floodsmart.gov/.

#FloodInsurance #BeReady

Happy Independence Day!

As we celebrate with family, friends, and neighbors, remember, freedom is not free and take time to honor those who fought and continue to fight to preserve our founding principles which make America the greatest nation known to mankind.

Today’s Supreme Court ruling confirms President Biden’s student loan bailout is unconstitutional. 

Those who work hard and make sacrifices to pay their debts should not be punished while others get a free ride.

Biden’s unfair mortgage rule penalizes those with good credit to help pay for mortgages for those with bad credit.

I voted for the Middle Class Borrower Protection Act to cancel this new rule. Redistribution of wealth is not the American way.

I want to personally recognize Mr. Joe Hayes, a WWII veteran who recently celebrated his 100th birthday. Mr. Hayes, of Wilmington, celebrated with a drive-by parade, while surrounded by his friends and family.

Happy Birthday, Joe

wect.com/2023/06/18/communit…

Over 13 million American’s suffer from #PTSD. If you or someone you know is struggling, please use the resources below:

Suicide & Crisis Lifeline: Dial 988
Veterans Crisis Line: Text 838255
National Center for PTSD: Visit ptsd.va.gov
#PTSDAwarenessDay #BreakTheStigma
The @NCRLA is working to help small businesses across the state thrive in a challenging economy. I enjoyed meeting with them and hearing about their efforts!

What a privilege to welcome Samantha Strahley of @HoggardHS in Wilmington to DC. 

As the winner of this year's NC-07 Congressional Art Competition, her artwork will be showcased for one year in the US Capitol. Congrats Samantha!

With my support, this week the House passed The CHOICE Arrangement Act.

With rising healthcare costs, more small businesses are struggling to stay afloat. This bill provides more healthcare choices for employees while increasing affordability for small business owners.

I’m excited to announce the third annual WATERS Summit in Greenville, NC.

Alongside @RepGregMurphy, I look forward to hearing from community leaders and field experts at this year’s event as we work together to better protect North Carolinians from flooding.

Juneteenth is a tribute to the day in 1865 when slaves in Galveston, Texas were the last to learn they were free — two years after the Emancipation Proclamation.  Today we celebrate freedom and independence for all & the end of slavery in the United States.

My prayers are with the crews currently responding to the wildfire at Green Swamp Game Land in Brunswick County.

Please continue to monitor @NCDAQ_Forecast for air quality reports & @NCDOT for road closure information. Stay safe!

wect.com/2023/06/15/wheres-t…
Happy Father's Day!

NC’s electric co-op’s are critical for deploying reliable electricity and broadband to our small and rural communities.

Thanks to @fourcty, @lremc, Brunswick EMC, @SouthRiverEMC & @NCelectriccoop for meeting with me to share more about your efforts in NC-07.

NC-07 is full of many unique cities and towns, and it was great to join local mayors from across the district to hear their priorities & collaborate on ways we can work together to make each community a better place to live and work.

Thanks to @NCLeague for hosting this event!
Don’t forget! There’s still time to submit your feedback for the 2023 Farm Bill before the public portal closes on Friday, June 16th.

Today we celebrate the 248th Birthday of the U.S. Army!

Please join me in saluting our nation’s brave heroes who have made significant contributions to keeping our country safe. Thank you for your service!

Today we honor the 246th anniversary of Old Glory.

The American flag will always represent freedom, hope, and those heroes who bravely defend it. Happy Flag Day!

🚨Legislation I cosponsored to block the Biden Administration's unconstitutional pistol brace rule just passed the House.

This alarming rule infringes on the Second Amendment rights of law-abiding gun owners, including many disabled combat veterans.
Even if you were to assume egregious mishandling, it does not merit criminal prosecution. This smacks of a political prosecution to the highest degree. (3/3)

from that of nonpartisan, professional law enforcement to weaponization of the law for political purposes. It is quite common for Presidents to take classified documents when they leave office since much of their daily work while in office involves classified documents. (2/3)

Regardless of what one may think of President Trump, equal justice under the law should be just that — equal. Eight years of President Obama and Attorney General Eric Holder transformed the upper echelons of the Department of Justice and the FBI (1/3)

North Carolinians know natural disasters don't discriminate - that’s why I introduced legislation to ensure families living in condos, co-ops, & homeowner associations have access to the same FEMA assistance as single-family homeowners. 
rouzer.house.gov/news/docume…

Today marks the 79th anniversary of the D-Day landings on the beaches of Normandy. Shall we always remember the thousands of heroes who fought to defeat tyranny. Your selfless sacrifice turned the tide of WWII, and we salute you for your courage and valor.

To help deter the surge at our southern border, I introduced the Asylum Accountability Act.

Even if the Biden Administration continues to refuse to enforce our laws, this bill stops anyone from using our asylum process as a get-out-of-jail free card.
rouzer.house.gov/news/docume…
My statement on the Fiscal Responsibility Act ➡️

This Memorial Day, please join me in honoring the brave men and women who made the ultimate sacrifice to protect our country and preserve our liberty.

We will never forget their service and selflessness — a poignant reminder that our freedom is not free.

.@Brunscosheriff John Ingram dedicated his life to our community during his long & distinguished tenure in law enforcement.

It was my honor to congratulate him on his retirement and extend my sincere gratitude for his service on the House Floor. piped.video/Ud5oLQVmHiQ

Today's SCOTUS ruling on WOTUS is a decisive win for our farm families, small businesses, property owners, and entire communities.

The only reasonable step for the Administration to take now is to withdraw its ill-advised rule.

With my support, @HouseGOP just passed the HALT Fentanyl Act.

Lives are on the line, and this bill gives law enforcement the tools they need to curb the fentanyl scourge and protect our communities from this deadly drug.

Congratulations to Samantha Strahley from @HoggardHS in Wilmington on being named the NC-07 Art Competition Winner.

Samantha's piece entitled “Raccoon” will represent our district well and I look forward to viewing her artwork displayed in the halls of the U.S. Capitol!

.@TransportGOP took a huge step in alleviating supply chain disruptions, easing labor shortages & providing targeted investment in critical infrastructure with yesterday's markup.  Read more ➡️ rouzer.house.gov/news/docume…

I’m pleased the Army Corps approved an emergency exception allowing Wrightsville Beach to use their 50-year traditional borrow site.

For long-term certainty, this emergency exception needs to be made permanent. Read more on my efforts to do just that ➡️ bit.ly/41ZV6pH

Had a great time on the @ACEC_National podcast where we covered my priorities as Chairman of @TransportGOP Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment. We talked WOTUS, water resources infrastructure, and the importance of STEM education.

Check out our conversation below!

Upholding the integrity of US trade law is crucial to protecting a robust supply chain, textile jobs, and cotton growers in North Carolina & across the country.

Proud to join @PatrickMcHenry on this bipartisan letter urging Sec. Raimondo to bolster US trade law against China.

It was my honor to remember the life and legacy of @NewHanoverCo Commissioner Deb Hays during a speech on the House Floor.

Deb was a pillar in our community and the lives impacted by her legacy are countless. Hers truly was a great life lived.

During National Police Week, join me in thanking those in NC-07 and across the country who wear the badge and put their lives on the line to keep us safe.

I proudly stand with America’s law enforcement officers & will always support their heroic service!

I led today's @TransportGOP Subcommittee on Water Resources & Environment hearing on how the Clean Water Act can be modernized 50 years following its enactment.

In doing so, we can strive for American prosperity while protecting the quality of our water. bit.ly/3pGhRS5

The ongoing missile attacks targeting innocent Israelis must not be tolerated.

I remain fully supportive of Israel’s fundamental right to defend itself and protect its citizens from this violence and terrorism.
Wishing every mom a Happy Mother’s Day. Thank you for all you do!

🚨With my support, House Republicans just passed H.R. 2, the Secure the Border Act. With Title 42 set to expire, our bill:

✅Finishes wall construction
✅Ends catch & release
✅Strengthens border patrol staffing
✅Reinstates Trump-era successful Remain in Mexico policy

The Biden Admin is prohibiting Wrightsville Beach from using their 50-year traditional borrow site for much-needed beach renourishment.

My bill reverses this decision, allowing Wrightsville Beach to return to a regular renourishment schedule. Read more: bit.ly/42tFnjI

It was great to sit down with the NC Broadband Cooperatives to highlight the importance of rural broadband deployment and to collaborate on ways Congress can support those working to provide high-speed internet to underserved areas.

🚨Danger remains after storms strike. Please use caution after storms, review the tips below, and remember nearly half of hurricane fatalities occur after the storm.

#HurricanePrep #HurricaneSeason2023

The University of North Carolina at Pembroke is doing great work to empower students and prepare them to kickstart fulfilling careers. 
 
Thanks to Chancellor Cummings for showing me around campus as we discussed ways to work together in support of UNC Pembroke and its students.

Thanks to the Kiwanis of Robeson-Lumberton and the Lumberton Rotary Club for hosting me! We had a great conversation about issues important to Robeson County, including the Lumbee Fairness Act which I’m proud to champion in the 118th Congress.

As we head into hurricane season, make sure you know what to expect from the hazards you may face during a storm. Remain vigilant, stay up to date with local news coverage, heed the advice of local officials, and stay safe. #HurricanePrep #HurricaneSeason2023

When a storm threatens your area, act immediately to be prepared:

🛠️Protect your home
🐶Determine sheltering options & consider your pets
🎒Ready your go-bag
🏡Help your neighbors
🚨Follow evacuation orders

#HurricanePrep #HurricaneSeason2023

It was great to meet with @AARPNC members in my Wilmington district office to discuss their priorities and my commitment to lowering the cost of living and protecting Social Security and Medicare benefits our seniors have earned.

Bladen Community College provides exceptional opportunities to their students to prepare them to join the workforce and excel.

I enjoyed touring their facilities and learning more about the opportunities and services they provide to enrich our community.

Are you prepared for hurricane season? Avoid the rush of last-minute preparations & use the resources below to help you stay safe!

✅Develop an evacuation plan
✅Assemble a disaster kit
✅Create a communication plan
✅Strengthen your home

On Saturday, I joined @HonorFlightCFA to welcome our veterans back home following their trip to DC.

I'm proud to represent such a large community of veterans in Southeastern North Carolina and always enjoy the opportunity to thank them for their service and heroism.

This week marks National Hurricane Preparedness Week & the first step in pre-season prep is understanding your risk for severe weather.

✅Consider threats
✅Determine if you live in a flood-prone area or evacuation zone
✅Identify your home’s structural risks

#HurricanePrep

I enjoyed meeting with NC-07's 2022 @CongressionalAC winners, Samin & Atiksh Bhan, to congratulate them on their hard work & success. 

Their app, Lookupp, promotes mental health and interpersonal relationships by encouraging users to look up from their phone screens.

It was an honor to speak at the National Water Policy Fly-In to provide a brief legislative update and to discuss my work to ensure families in Southeastern North Carolina and across the country have access to clean drinking water. #WaterWeek2023

Proud to join @RepRalphNorman & @CongressmanGT in the effort to repeal the Biden Admin’s new H-2A rule which is yet another example of a flawed regulatory agenda creating barriers to U.S. ag production & causing needless uncertainty for our farm families. bit.ly/3VjDjYT

We must get Washington’s spending under control.  Today’s vote is a major milestone achieved.

My full statement on the Limit, Save, Grow Act:

During my recent visit to Bladen County, I enjoyed a great lunch at the Cape Fear Farmer's Market in Elizabethtown.  I had the opportunity to visit with local officials, including Bladen County Sheriff McVicker and Bladen County Clerk of Court Cristin Hursey.

Happy 75th Independence Day to Israel!

Now, more than ever, the United States must be united in our support for a strong U.S.-Israel partnership. #Israel75

Read more about the Farm Bill roundtable from the @SampsonInd below.

Thanks to @CongressmanGT, @RepLaMalfa, @RepDonDavis, and @RepWileyNickel for joining and taking time to hear firsthand from those who know best! (4/4)

clintonnc.com/news/66381/lea…

For our last stop of the day, we toured @MtOlivePickles at the corner of Cucumber & Vine to see their impressive facilities & how they use their locally grown supply of NC cucumbers to manufacture one of the country’s most popular brand of pickles, peppers and relishes. (3/4)
Following the roundtable, we toured Warren Farming Company to view their family-owned operation which takes pride in producing NC sweetpotatoes, tobacco, and more. (2/4)

Last week, I hosted @HouseAgGOP Chairman @CongressmanGT in North Carolina for a Farm Bill Roundtable where an array of issues important to North Carolina farm families were brought front and center as we work to craft a new Farm Bill & address the needs of rural America. (1/4)

Don't forget! The Congressional Art Competition is now open for high school students who live or attend school in NC-07.🎨 

The deadline for submission is Friday, April 28th.    

For additional guidelines and requirements, visit: rouzer.house.gov/forms/submi…

Forcing female athletes to compete against biological males in women’s sports is dangerous, unfair & turns truth on its head.

With my support, the House passed the Protection of Women and Girls in Sports Act to defend female athletes' access to a fair playing field.

From leading the effort to block Biden’s WOTUS Rule to introducing a key component of H.R. 1 to lower energy costs, @TransportGOP has been instrumental during the first 100 days of a @HouseGOP majority.

Read more in my @WashTimes op-ed: bit.ly/3onuWPE

Proud to join @RepDustyJohnson, @RepColinAllred, & @RepAngieCraig in hosting today's Supply Chain Caucus roundtable to collaborate on policy solutions to improve the supply chain system.

Each idea shared today will help improve the ability to deliver goods across the country.

Congress spoke with a loud bipartisan voice and voted against this overreach, but without enough votes from the other side of the aisle to override the President’s veto.  We will continue to work to push back against and defang this onerous rule at every available opportunity.

The Biden Administration’s WOTUS rule is one of the most damaging in history, with the potential to devastate production agriculture, derail infrastructure projects & harm our economy.

piped.video/gHxM-3e1zH0

Thanks to @NewHanoverCo Emergency Management for giving me a tour of the new Emergency Operations Center in Wilmington.  It was great to meet with 911 operators, first responders, and law enforcement personnel who work around the clock to protect and serve our communities.

REMINDER: The Congressional Art Competition is now open for high school students who live or attend school in North Carolina's 7th District! 🎨

The deadline for submission is Friday, April 28th.  

For additional guidelines and requirements, visit: bit.ly/3L6Cz5M

I recently stopped by the @EtownWLChamber to visit with local leaders and job creators to discuss economic development opportunities, along with our shared goal of helping families and small businesses continue to succeed in our community.  Thanks for hosting me!

247 years ago, North Carolina became the first colony to declare independence from Great Britain with the signing of the Halifax Resolves!

I’m proud to pay tribute to this historic date & NC's commitment to liberty with the quill pen in my Congressional logo. #FirstInFreedom🪶📜

I’m proud H.R. 1 includes my bill to ensure the development of our Nation’s energy infrastructure – enabling the US to become energy dominant once again.

American energy production is critical to our economy, our food security, our national security, and a cleaner environment.

Happy Easter! May God bring you and your family peace and joy on this special day.
 
1 Peter 1:3: “Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! In his great mercy he has given us new birth into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead.”

My prayers are with our ally Israel and the innocent Israeli families who are under attack by Iranian-backed terrorists during Passover.

The United States must always support Israel’s fundamental right to defend itself from violence and terrorism.
1 Peter 2:24: “He himself bore our sins in his body on the tree, that we might die to sin and live to righteousness. By his wounds you have been healed.”

On this Good Friday, God, through His son, Jesus, accepted and endured the burden of our sins through His death on the cross so all those who confess their sins, acknowledge & believe in Him would have eternal life. May His gift be ever-present in our minds at all times.

While President Biden bows to the demands of radical environmentalists at the expense of hard-working Americans, Congress came together — on a bipartisan basis — to stand up for families, farmers, and entire communities by rejecting his flawed WOTUS rule.
Thank you to the members from @nchousingbuilds for meeting with me last week to discuss ways to increase affordable housing opportunities across NC-07.

The Congressional Art Competition is now open for high school students who live or attend school in North Carolina's 7th District! 🎨

The deadline for submission is Friday, April 28th.

For additional guidelines and requirements, please visit: rouzer.house.gov/forms/submi…

Congrats to fellow @NCState Alum @Astro_Christina on being named the first member of the #Artemis II Moon crew & first woman to orbit the moon! 

Go Pack!🌕🚀🐺

I was proud to join @SpeakerMcCarthy and Chairman @RepSamGraves at the signing ceremony for our legislation to block Biden's burdensome WOTUS rule.

Congress came together to stand up for families, farmers, and entire communities by opposing this executive overreach.

It’s interesting this is the same District Attorney who refuses to prosecute legitimate crime in NYC, yet indicts a former President on the basis of partisanship eroding the trust of the American public even further.
This indictment is the most recent occurrence in what has become a disturbing pattern of weaponizing our government and legal institutions for political purposes.

Always enjoy meeting with COL Bennett, Commander of @USACEWilmington, to stay updated on their projects in Southeastern North Carolina. We discussed the importance of beach renourishment, flood protection, and more.

Low cost, reliable energy is fundamental to prosperity, and I'm proud the House passed H.R. 1 which includes my bill to help ensure the development of our nation’s energy infrastructure at a time when it is most necessary.

Thank you to @NCLeague members from @CityofWilm, @CityOfFayNC, Town of Pembroke, City of Lumberton, and Town of Chadbourn for meeting with me in DC to discuss several of our shared priorities and the issues important to our communities across North Carolina’s 7th District.

I applaud the Senate for passing this commonsense legislation I led alongside Chairman @RepSamGraves to rescind the Biden Admin's flawed WOTUS rule.

This rule targets our farm families, small businesses, homebuilders & entire communities because of its overreaching definition.
Today and every day, we remember the courageous individuals who served our nation during the Vietnam War. Their bravery and commitment to duty will never be forgotten. #VietnamVeteransDay

Low cost, reliable energy produced in America is fundamental to prosperity. It’s critical to our economy, our food security & our national security.  

I urge my colleagues to help unleash U.S. energy potential, lower costs for families & support H.R. 1!
piped.video/EayM-8C0clE

Proud to join Majority Leader @SteveScalise & the House Energy Action Team to highlight @TransportGOP’s contributions to the Lower Energy Costs Act! Our work ensures we can build the infrastructure necessary to responsibly utilize our energy resources & lower costs for Americans.

I’m excited to have my bill included in H.R. 1 - the Lower Energy Costs Act. Preventing states from blocking critical energy projects on political grounds will boost domestic production, ensure our energy independence, and lower costs.

Read more: wsj.com/articles/the-house-g…

I enjoyed meeting with the Topsail Island Shoreline Protection Commission last week. We discussed beach renourishment on Topsail Island along with flood insurance and ways we can improve disaster recovery efforts.

I’m humbled to receive the Drinking Water Leadership Award for my efforts to address PFAS contaminants and how they affect drinking water, health & the environment.

I will continue working to ensure families in Southeastern North Carolina have access to clean drinking water.

I’m very saddened to hear the news of the passing of Deb Hays.  She was a devoted public servant and will be sorely missed.  May God grant her family, colleagues and friends great peace and comfort during this very difficult time.

As National Ag Week comes to an end, don’t forget to #ThankAFarmer three times a day (breakfast, lunch, and dinner!) – especially those in North Carolina whose hard work provides the food and fiber to fuel our state and country.

Congratulations to the @floodcoalition as it marks its 5th anniversary! I'm proud to be recognized as an AFC #FederalChampion and look forward to continuing our work together on innovative solutions protecting Southeastern North Carolina from flood risk.

This #NationalAgWeek, we recognize our nation’s farm families who work tirelessly to feed America and the entire world. Because of their hard work and dedication, they keep our communities thriving. Happy National Ag Week!

I’m pleased to reintroduce the Healthy H2O Act alongside @chelliepingree to help bring forward solutions to ensure access to safe drinking water.

The bill would help our communities identify & address contaminants, such as GenX, in their drinking water. bit.ly/3lGGTPj

Congrats to Michael McWhorter from Burgaw on being named NC Small Business Person of the Year!

In Southeastern North Carolina, small businesses drive our economy & I congratulate Michael on this achievement. Thank you for making our community a better place to live & work.

Happy #NationalAgDay!

Join me in thanking the hardworking farm families of NC-07 for all they do to provide the safest, most abundant food supply in the world. It's an honor to serve as their voice on @HouseAgGOP!

🚨 JUST INTRODUCED – H.R. 1 the Lower Energy Costs Act!

🚨The House just passed my legislation to protect Americans from government overreach.

Biden’s WOTUS rule is a nuclear warhead aimed squarely at our farm families, small businesses, homebuilders, every property owner, & entire communities because of its overreaching definition.

Today, the House will vote on legislation I introduced to overturn the Biden Administration’s flawed WOTUS rule.

If not stopped, Biden’s rule will expand the federal government’s control over your land, making it harder to farm, build, and generate economic prosperity.

Congress must repeal the Biden Administration's flawed WOTUS rule so Americans across the country are protected from subjective regulatory overreach making it harder to farm, build and generate economic prosperity.

America’s Strategic Petroleum Reserve protects our country during national emergencies.  Yet over the past two years, Biden has drained the SPR to coverup the consequences of his war on American energy.
 
I just voted to END the sale of our emergency fuel supply to China.

The 118th Congress Rules Package restores the People’s House through the following framework:

- Ends proxy voting
- Provides 72 hours for Members to review bills before being voted on 
- Bills must be on a single subject
- Allows Americans to access the Capitol once again

House Republicans voted to END proxy voting in Congress.

I never voted by proxy, and I proudly voted to put it to an end!

If Americans have to show up at work every day – Members of Congress should do the same.
